text: Isopropyl alcohol, also known as isopropanol, is a chemical compound made of carbon, hydrogen, and oxygen. It has the chemical formula or . Isopropyl alcohol is a common active ingredient in rubbing alcohol. It is also a common solvent, used in some nail polish removers and dry erase markers. == Safety == Isopropyl alcohol evaporates very quickly and is very flammable, so it should be kept away from fire or any potential ignition source. Isopropyl alcohol is more toxic than ethanol, but less toxic than methanol. Death from isopropanol consumption is rare. Category:Alkanols Category:Oxygenates Category:Alcohol solvents
title: Isopropyl alcohol
